page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY OF WATER MILL.
page.content: There was a mill at Fladbury at the time of the original Domesday Survey. The water mill was a valuable part of the manor.It ground corn using two water-wheels until the turn of the century and at that time the water wheel at the end of the mill was replaced with two turbines. In 1888 electricity was first charged at the mill by the large water-wheel but two turbines were installed in the early 1900's which ran until 1926. Since 1980 the area where the old turbines were has been rebuilt.A replacement turbine now drives a 13KW generator and the power charged provides domestic heating for the attached mill house.
